intro: Neoraimondia arequipensis var. aticensis, commonly known as the Aticeno mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of Peru. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The species is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often found in cloud forests and paramo ecosystems. The plant's botanical significance lies in its unique adaptations to the harsh conditions of the Andes.
